nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: The iconic pond at APU's main campus. Usually serene, today you notice plastic bottles and wrappers near the edges.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: A student with a garbage bag is trying to clean up, but seems overwhelmed by the amount of trash.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: The pond is home to fish and turtles. The trash pollution is affecting their habitat.

nodes.speaker: Iman
nodes.text: Oh hey! You're from Prof Danny's class right? I'm doing a solo cleanup. Every Tuesday I come here. Sad seeing sampah end up in the water.

nodes.speaker: Iman
nodes.text: It's just me today, my friends had class. Want to help for a bit? I have extra gloves.

choices.text: Yeah, let's do this together. Four hands better than two.
I can help for 15 minutes. Got tutorial soon.
Sorry, I don't want to get my hands dirty. Good luck though!

nodes.speaker: Iman
nodes.text: Yes!  Terima kasih!  You know, I started this alone 3 months ago. Now sometimes 5-6 people join. Small actions attract others.

nodes.speaker: Iman
nodes.text: 15 minutes is perfect!  Even picking up 10 pieces of trash makes a difference.  The turtles here will thank you.

nodes.speaker: Iman
nodes.text: Oh...  okay. But you know, this trash affects all of us. The same water flows through our campus. Maybe next time?

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: Together, you collect two full bags of trash — plastic bottles, food wrappers, even a broken umbrella. The pond looks noticeably cleaner.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: You watch Iman continue alone, methodically picking up trash.  There's something admirable about her persistence.

nodes.speaker: Iman
nodes.text: You know what I've learned? Most people want to help, they just need someone to start first. Be the first, and others will follow.

choices.text: You're right. I want to be that person who starts things too.
Isn't it tiring doing this when most people don't care?

nodes.speaker: Iman
nodes.text: That's the spirit! Start small. Consistency matters more than scale. And hey, you already started today by joining me!

nodes.speaker: Iman
nodes.text: Honestly? Sometimes.  But then I see the pond getting cleaner, the turtles swimming happily...  and I remember why I started. Impact, not applause.

nodes.speaker: system
nodes.text: You've participated in a student-led environmental cleanup.  (SDG 6: Clean Water, SDG 14: Life Below Water, SDG 15: Life on Land)

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: Evening at the USM bus stop. The semester is ending soon.  You wait for the Rapid Penang bus, reflecting on everything that's happened.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: A junior student you recognize from the food bank. She's reading a book on sustainable development.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: A poster promoting public transport:  'Satu bas, 40 kereta kurang. Pilihan anda membentuk masa depan. '

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: The bench has a small plaque: 'Donated by USM Green Campus Initiative 2019. '

nodes.speaker: Anis
nodes.text: Senior!  I heard you've been really active with sustainability stuff this semester. I'm thinking of joining Pantri Siswa next sem.  Any advice?

choices.text: Just start. Don't wait until you feel ready.  Show up, and you'll learn along the way.
Talk to Kak Sarah at the food bank. She'll guide you. And bring friends — it's more fun together.
Hmm, I'm not really the best person to ask.  I just did it for the experience.

nodes.speaker: Anis
nodes.text: Wow, that's really inspiring, senior! You're right — I keep waiting for the 'perfect time' but it never comes. I'll sign up tomorrow!

nodes.speaker: Anis
nodes.text: Thanks, senior! I'll find Kak Sarah.  And yeah, I'll drag my roommates along.  Hopefully they won't complain too much, haha.

nodes.speaker: Anis
nodes.text: Oh...  okay. I thought you were really passionate about it.  Nevermind, I'll ask someone else.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: Aisyah and Chai Lam appear, also waiting for the bus. They look tired but satisfied after a long semester.

nodes.speaker: Aisyah
nodes.text: Eh!  There you are!  Wah, one whole semester of SDG adventures.  Remember when you didn't even know what SDG was? Now look at you — cleaning ponds, packing food boxes!

nodes.speaker: Chai Lam
nodes.text: Betul tu! From 'aiya, extra work' to actually leading initiatives. Prof Danny would be proud.  Character development sia!

nodes.speaker: Aisyah
nodes.text: Serious question though — looking back, what changed for you? Like, what's different now compared to the start of sem?

choices.text: I realized I don't have to wait for someone else to start. If I see a problem, I can be the one to act.
I feel more connected now — to people, to the campus, to something bigger than just my grades.
Honestly, I'm still figuring it out. But at least I'm trying now.
Hmm, not sure lah. It was interesting but I don't know if I'll continue.

nodes.speaker: Aisyah
nodes.text: THAT.  That right there is growth. You went from 'not my problem' to 'I can be part of the solution.' I'm actually proud of you lah!

nodes.speaker: Chai Lam
nodes.text: Same feeling here bro. Before this, uni was just classes and assignments. Now it feels like we're actually part of a community. Different vibes.

nodes.speaker: Aisyah
nodes.text: That's okay!  The fact that you're trying means you're already ahead of most people.  Progress, not perfection right?

nodes.speaker: Chai Lam
nodes.text: Hmm, that's a bit sad to hear. But hey, maybe next sem something will click?  Don't close the door completely lah.

nodes.speaker: Aisyah
nodes.text: So, what's the plan for next semester? Prof Danny mentioned the SDG Campus Challenge — teams compete to create the best sustainability project. We should join!

choices.text: Count me in.  Actually, I have some ideas already.  Let's form a team!
I'll join if you lead lah. Still learning, but I want to be part of it.
Let me think about it first. Next sem quite packed also.

nodes.speaker: Chai Lam
nodes.text: Wooo! That's what I'm talking about!  Okay okay, I'll handle logistics, Aisyah does outreach, you lead the vision.  Dream team confirmed!

nodes.speaker: Aisyah
nodes.text: Deal! We need people who show up consistently anyway. That's more valuable than having a fancy title.  Welcome to the team!

nodes.speaker: Aisyah
nodes.text: Okay, no pressure.  But the offer is always open. You know where to find us — probably at the food bank or covered in compost somewhere!

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: The Rapid Penang bus pulls up. The sun is setting over the campus, casting a warm glow over everything.

nodes.speaker: Chai Lam
nodes.text: You know what? This semester started with us dragging you to learn about SDGs. Now you're the one inspiring juniors.  Full circle, bro.

nodes.speaker: Aisyah
nodes.text: The SDGs aren't just goals on a poster.  They're about choices we make every day. And you've been making good ones.  Jom, bus dah sampai!

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: You board the bus with your friends, feeling different from the person who started this semester.  The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step — or in this case, a single choice to care.

nodes.speaker: Narrator
nodes.text: Looking out the window as the campus fades into the distance, you realize:  you don't need to change the whole world. You just need to change your corner of it.  And that's exactly what you've started doing.

nodes.speaker: system
nodes.text: End of Chapter 4: Becoming a Changemaker.  Your journey from awareness to action is complete. But the real journey — making sustainable choices every day — is just beginning.
